title: Downloading block bodies: high download bandwidth but no progress
body:
Hi.

I just resynced erigon from scratch and it synced up to around block 16.9M. But now when it tries to download block bodies (stage 5/15 Bodies) the block_num= just increases more and more slowly until eventually it completely stops. At the same time, Erigon seems to be receiving blocks at high bandwidth (~10MB/s) and the delivered= counter goes up really fast (despite block_num= and remaining= not moving). It really seems like Erigon is just DOSing the network with block requests which are either for blocks it already has or which it's ignoring for whatever other reason.

A relevant extract of my logs:

```
[INFO] [05-20|18:56:10.398] [5/15 Bodies] Downloading block bodies   block_num=16932653 delivery/sec=11.3MB wasted/sec=2.1MB remaining=369881 delivered=2062 cache=256.0MB alloc=3.1GB sys=9.4GB
[INFO] [05-20|18:56:30.390] [5/15 Bodies] Downloading block bodies   block_num=16932653 delivery/sec=10.8MB wasted/sec=0B remaining=369881 delivered=4302 cache=256.0MB alloc=4.7GB sys=9.4GB
[INFO] [05-20|18:56:50.386] [5/15 Bodies] Downloading block bodies   block_num=16932653 delivery/sec=8.9MB wasted/sec=0B remaining=369881 delivered=6024 cache=256.0MB alloc=3.9GB sys=9.4GB
[INFO] [05-20|18:56:54.925] [txpool] stat                            block=16916999 pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=4.1GB sys=9.4GB
[INFO] [05-20|18:57:10.389] [5/15 Bodies] Downloading block bodies   block_num=16932653 delivery/sec=8.8MB wasted/sec=0B remaining=369881 delivered=7788 cache=256.0MB alloc=2.8GB sys=9.4GB
[INFO] [05-20|18:57:30.389] [5/15 Bodies] Downloading block bodies   block_num=16932653 delivery/sec=7.3MB wasted/sec=12.5KB remaining=369881 delivered=9192 cache=256.0MB alloc=3.9GB sys=9.4GB
```

Full logs attached:
[erigon_logs_1.txt](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/files/11523091/erigon_logs_1.txt)

Version: git_branch=HEAD git_tag=v2.42.0-dirty git_commit=beb97784d43ece5acde365a74efe8763692ebdba

Command: erigon --nat=stun --port=[...] --http.addr=[...] --http.api=eth,erigon,engine,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool --authrpc.addr=[...] --externalcl --db.pagesize=16K

My system is running normally. Lots of RAM available. CPUs, disks, and network fine.

I actually had a similar issue in a previous version of Erigon from a few months back (different instance) and I got around it back then by running Erigon for 10 minutes in a loop until everything was synced. This worked back then because block_num progress would slow down gradually after each restart (with normal or acceptable speed at start).

But even this hack doesn't seem to work anymore. After a restart, almost no progress is made and things grind to a complete halt after only downloading a few hundred blocks:

